definition: Eighth Route Army, the larger of the two major Chinese communist forces fighting the Japanese in the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945)
eight/8
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind

sentences.english: A struggle has been started against the tendency towards new warlordism in the Eighth Route Army .
sentences.chinese: 在八路军中，开始向新军阀主义倾向作斗争。

sentences.english: A security guard, waiting for the signal to zhao WeiZi continues the eighth route army.
sentences.chinese: 保安队放松警惕，八路军则继续等待赵家圩子的信号。

sentences.english: Zhang Yimei learned that the eighth route army, the next step in meter.
sentences.chinese: 张怡梅得知八路军的下一步计划，计上心头。

sentences.english: In areas occupied by the army, the landlords also go under easily.
sentences.chinese: 在八路军进驻的地区，地主也不难制服。

sentences.english: Near the 8th Route Army areas he began to look for allies.
sentences.chinese: 在八路军驻区附近，农民则盼望八路军来。

sentences.english: Near the 8th Route Army areas he began to look for allies.

sentences.english: They began to fraternize with the Manchurian people and then with the 8th Route Army.
sentences.chinese: 他们开始同满洲人民来往，接着又同八路军来往。

sentences.english: TuanCheng chamber of commerce chairman see be on the decline, wants to be reconciled with the eighth route army.
sentences.chinese: 团城商会会长见大势已去，就想跟八路军和好。

sentences.english: He often went into enemy-occupied areas to gather information for the Eighth Route Army.
sentences.chinese: 他常常深入敌占区给八路军收集情报。

sentences.english: The eighth route army soldiers odbo following, but discovered by mao-tsair Lin, odbo sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 八路军战士老宋尾随，却被林茂才发现，老宋牺牲。

sentences.english: The eighth route army finally attack down the TuanCheng.
sentences.chinese: 八路军终于攻下了团城。

sentences.english: The eighth route army would have rejected TuanCheng.
sentences.chinese: 八路军是否会弃掉团城。

sentences.english: Although the scouts to quote, the eighth route army has pulled out of the snake winding.
sentences.chinese: 虽然侦察兵来报，八路军已经撤出了蛇盘山。

sentences.english: With the eighth route army who have dealings businessman is none escape by luck.
sentences.chinese: 凡是跟八路军有来往的商人皆无一幸免。

sentences.english: Then were rushed to the eighth route army hospital.
sentences.chinese: 随后被紧急送往八路军后方医院医治。

sentences.english: Strategically , the Eighth Route Army is centring them on Shansi.
sentences.chinese: 在战略上，八路军正以山西为中心进行战争。

definition: New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
nationalist forces
puppet army
Shanxi 山西, Chahar 察哈爾|察哈尔 and Hebei 河北 (three provinces of the Republic of China in the period 1912-1936)
Japanese army/Japanese troops
volunteer army
Japanese devil (common term of abuse in wartime China and in subsequent writing)
to resist Japan (esp. during WW2)/anti-Japanese (esp. wartime activities)
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Fu Zuoyi (1895-1974), Guomindang general, subsequently PRC top general and politician
war of resistance, especially the war against Japan (1937-1945)
(China's) War of Resistance against Japan (1937-1945)

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Yan Xishan (1883-1960), warlord in Shanxi
Huaihai Campaign (Nov 1948-Jan 1949), one of the three major campaigns by the People's Liberation Army near the end of the Chinese Civil War, considered the determining battle of the war
Great Victory at Pingxing Pass, ambush of Japanese troops by Communist forces on September 25, 1937 at 平型關|平型关[Ping2 xing2 guan1]
